titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of the Governor's Special Advisor on Disability Issues in the Workplace, 2006-2010
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 51127
titlepage.author: Paige Neal

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of the Governor's Special Advisor on Disability Issues in the Workplace, 2010-2013
did.origination: Virginia. Office of the Secretary of Health and Human Resources

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Privacy protected and confidential information is restricted from public access for 75 years (Code of Virginia 42.1-78). Restricted records in this collection have been flagged but not removed. Types of flagged information may include, but is not limited to: medical records, financial records, vital statistics records, personal information including Social Security numbers, Social Services records, juvenile court records, administrative investigation records, attorney-client privileged documents, personnel records, proprietary information, and terrorism information and response records. Some documents may be closed in their entirety, while others may allow for redaction.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Special Advisor on Disability Issues in the Workplace, 2006-2010. Accession 51127, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 51127 transferred by the Office of the Secretary of Health and Human Resources, 8 January 2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Ed Turner was appointed Special Advisor on Disability Issues in the Workplace in September of 2006. This position was located with the Office of the Secretary of Health and Human resources and served as a senior advisor to the Governor on disability employment policy. Turner served as the Governor's representative on disabily employment and community integration as part of the Olmstead Initiative and on the Virginia Disability Commission, and worked closely with the Senior Advisor for Workforce Issues. The special advisor also served as an advocate to advance disability employment and as a liaison to the disability community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains records created and maintained by Governor Kaine's Special Advisor on Disability Issues in the Workplace.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I. Correspondence and Supporting Documentation - Office of the Secretary, 2010-2011;
